Package algorithms

Class DoublyLinkedList<T extends DoublyLinkedList.DoublyLinkedNode>

java.lang.Object
algorithms.DoublyLinkedList<T>
Type Parameters:
T - node type that is or extends DoublyLinkedNode
public class DoublyLinkedList<T extends DoublyLinkedList.DoublyLinkedNode> extends Object
implementation of a doubly linked list. note that it is not a circularly linked list. specifically, list.head.prev == null and list.tail.next == null.
Author:
nichole

  • Constructor Details

    • DoublyLinkedList

      public DoublyLinkedList()

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(T node)
      add to end of doubly-linked list. runtime complexity is O(1).
      Parameters:
      node - node to add

    • addLast

      public void addLast(T node)
      insert at end of doubly-linked list. this method simply invokes add(node). runtime complexity is O(1).
      Parameters:
      node - node to add to end of list

    • addFirst

      public void addFirst(T node)
      insert at beginning of doubly-linked list. runtime complexity is O(1).
      Parameters:
      node - node to add to beginning of list

    • addBefore

      public void addBefore(T node, T refNode)
      insert before reference node refNode in doubly-linked list. runtime complexity is O(1).
      Parameters:
      node - node to add to beginning of list
      refNode - , the node already in DoublyLinkedList that we insert node in front of. If refNode is null, then we expect that this.head == null and then node becomes the this.head.

    • unlink

      public void unlink(T node)
      unlink node from the doubly-linked list. note, currently it is the user's responsibility to make sure the node is in the list before invoking this as the method does not perform a contains check to keep the runtime complexity small. runtime complexity is O(1).
      Parameters:
      node - the instance of T already in this instance.

    • search

      public T search(T node)
      search for an identical node in this doubly-linked list instance. Note that the runtime complexity worse case is O(n) where n is the number of items in this doubly-linked list instance.
      Parameters:
      node - an instance of type T which extends DoublyLinkedNode.
      Returns:
      node the node in this doubly-linked list in which .equals(node) returns true, else null for no node found.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(T node)
      search for an identical node in this doubly-linked list instance. Note that the runtime complexity worse case is O(n) where n is the number of items in this doubly-linked list instance.
      Parameters:
      node - the node in this doubly-linked list in which .equals(node) returns true, else null for no node found.
      Returns:
      node to search for in list

    • removeLast

      public T removeLast()
      unlink the last element from the list and return it. for use when want to treat this doubly linked list as LIFO, assuming items were inserted using add().
      Returns:
      last node if any

    • removeFirst

      public T removeFirst()
      unlink the first element from the list and return it. for use when want to treat this doubly linked list as FIFO, assuming items were inserted using add().
      Returns:
      first node that was in the list

    • peekFirst

      public T peekFirst()
      return the first element in the list without removing it from the list.
      Returns:
      returns first item in the list (note: it is not a copy of the item, intentionally)

    • peekLast

      public T peekLast()
      return the last element in the list without removing it from the list.
      Returns:
      the last item in the list. (not: it is not a copy of the item, intentionally).

    • clear

      public void clear()

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns:

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns:
